content.p: Assistant Professor, Faculty of Social Sciences Dr. Kamal Badar serves as an Assistant Professor at Nottingham University Business School, University of Nottingham, Malaysia. His academic journey includes roles as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the School of Management, Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand, a Senior Researcher at Prince Sultan University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and an Assistant Professor at the University of Balochistan, Pakistan. Dr. Badar earned his PhD in Management from the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), Thailand. His dedication to education extends to receiving a prestigious scholarship for professional certification in Management education from the University of Massachusetts, USA. Notably, he was invited as a visiting scholar to Brigham Young University, USA, where he delivered lectures to esteemed faculty members. I have extensive teaching experience and have taught many courses in OB/HRM and Strategy at different levels and in different countries.
